sn45.24:1.2: “Bhikkhus, whether for a layperson or one gone forth, I do not praise the wrong way.
sn45.24:1.3: Whether it is a layperson or one gone forth who is practising wrongly, because of undertaking the wrong way of practice he does not attain the method, the Dhamma that is wholesome.
sn45.24:2.1: And what, bhikkhus, is the wrong way?
sn45.24:2.2: It is: wrong view, wrong intention, wrong speech, wrong action, wrong livelihood, wrong effort, wrong remembrance, wrong composure.
sn45.24:2.3: This is called the wrong way.
sn45.24:2.4: Bhikkhus, whether for a layperson or one gone forth, I do not praise the wrong way.
sn45.24:2.5: Whether it is a layperson or one gone forth who is practising wrongly, because of undertaking the wrong way of practice he does not attain the method, the Dhamma that is wholesome.”
sn45.24:3.1: “Bhikkhus, whether for a layperson or one gone forth, I praise the right way.
sn45.24:3.2: Whether it is a layperson or one gone forth who is practising rightly, because of undertaking the right way of practice he attains the method, the Dhamma that is wholesome.
sn45.24:3.3: And what, bhikkhus, is the right way?
sn45.24:3.4: It is: right view, right intention, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right remembrance, right composure.
sn45.24:3.5: This is called the right way.
sn45.24:3.6: Bhikkhus, whether for a layperson or one gone forth, I praise the right way.
sn45.24:3.7: Whether it is a layperson or one gone forth who is practising rightly, because of undertaking the right way of practice he attains the method, the Dhamma that is wholesome.”
